Toggle Menu

salt.modules.ipset

Support for ipset

add

Syntax

salt.modules.ipset.add(
								set=None,
								entry=None,
								family='ipv4',
								**kwargs
								)

Details

Append an entry to the specified set.

CLI Example:

salt '*' ipset.add setname 192.168.1.26

salt '*' ipset.add setname 192.168.0.3,AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF

check

Syntax

salt.modules.ipset.check(
								set=None,
								entry=None,
								family='ipv4'
								)

Details

Check that an entry exists in the specified set.

CLI Example:

salt '*' ipset.check setname '192.168.0.1 comment "Hello"'

check_set

Syntax

salt.modules.ipset.check_set(
								set=None,
								family='ipv4'
								)

Details

New in version 2014.7.0.

Check that given ipset set exists.

CLI Example:

salt '*' ipset.check_set setname

delete

Syntax

salt.modules.ipset.delete(
								set=None,
								entry=None,
								family='ipv4',
								**kwargs
								)

Details

Delete an entry from the specified set.

CLI Example:

salt '*' ipset.delete setname 192.168.0.3,AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF

delete_set

Syntax

salt.modules.ipset.delete_set(
								set=None,
								family='ipv4'
								)

Details

New in version 2014.7.0.

Delete ipset set.

CLI Example:

salt '*' ipset.delete_set custom_set

IPv6:
salt '*' ipset.delete_set custom_set family=ipv6

flush

Syntax

salt.modules.ipset.flush(
								set=None,
								family='ipv4'
								)

Details

Flush entries in the specified set, Flush all sets if set is not specified.

CLI Example:

salt '*' ipset.flush

salt '*' ipset.flush set

IPv6:
salt '*' ipset.flush

salt '*' ipset.flush set

list_sets

Syntax

salt.modules.ipset.list_sets(
								family='ipv4'
								)

Details

New in version 2014.7.0.

List all ipset sets.

CLI Example:

salt '*' ipset.list_sets

new_set

Syntax

salt.modules.ipset.new_set(
								set=None,
								set_type=None,
								family='ipv4',
								comment=False,
								**kwargs
								)

Details

New in version 2014.7.0.

Create new custom set

CLI Example:

salt '*' ipset.new_set custom_set list:set

salt '*' ipset.new_set custom_set list:set comment=True

IPv6:
salt '*' ipset.new_set custom_set list:set family=ipv6

rename_set

Syntax

salt.modules.ipset.rename_set(
								set=None,
								new_set=None,
								family='ipv4'
								)

Details

New in version 2014.7.0.

Delete ipset set.

CLI Example:

salt '*' ipset.rename_set custom_set new_set=new_set_name

IPv6:
salt '*' ipset.rename_set custom_set new_set=new_set_name family=ipv6

test

Syntax

salt.modules.ipset.test(
								set=None,
								entry=None,
								family='ipv4',
								**kwargs
								)

Details

Test if an entry is in the specified set.

CLI Example:

salt '*' ipset.test setname 192.168.0.2

IPv6:
salt '*' ipset.test setname fd81:fc56:9ac7::/48

version

Syntax

salt.modules.ipset.version( )

Details

Return version from ipset --version

CLI Example:

salt '*' ipset.version
